title: Lead Value Engineer
description: Unqork empowers enterprises to accelerate growth by rapidly building, testing, and running applications that are designed to be AI-native.

raw.title: Lead Value Engineer
raw.excerpt: Unqork empowers enterprises to accelerate growth by rapidly building, testing, and running applications that are designed to be AI-native.
raw.description:
Unqork empowers enterprises to accelerate growth by rapidly building, testing, and running applications that are designed to be AI-native. Trusted by the world’s largest organizations in highly regulated industries, these applications become more secure over time while significantly reducing technical debt—allowing businesses to focus on innovation rather than maintenance. Unqork’s customers include Goldman Sachs, Marsh, BlackRock, and the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

At Unqork, we value inclusive and innovative thinkers who boldly challenge the status quo. We encourage you to apply!

Role Description

We are seeking a Value Engineer to join our Revenue Operations team. This role is situated at the intersection of technical architecture, financial analysis, and sales strategy. As a founding member of this function, you will act as a "back-office" strategist and high-impact, client-facing presence to develop the frameworks, models, and competitive benchmarks that quantify the value of the Unqork AI platform.

The Impact U will make:

  • Deal Execution & Closure: Working with the field sales organization, take ownership of the "commercial win" by addressing financial hurdles and business-case objections to drive deals to closure.
  • Custom Value Modeling: Build defensible, data-driven financial models (TCO, ROI, and NPV) that compare a prospect’s current vendor landscape, potentially failed AI projects, and technical debt against Unqork AI.
  • "Outside-In" Benchmarking: Develop proactive business cases using public financial filings (10-Ks) and industry benchmarks to provoke executive interest before deep discovery.
  • Champion Coaching: "Arm" internal champions with the narratives and financial data required to defend the Unqork AI business case during internal budgetary reviews and CFO audits.
  • Pricing & Packaging Strategy: Consult with the Deal Desk and Product teams to ensure Unqork AI’s commercial models capture the true value delivered while remaining competitive.
  • Programmatic Scalability: Build the "Value Playbook"—including self-service ROI calculators and training, along with customer facing business value assessments (BVAs) -- to empower the broader Sales and ADR teams to conduct value conversations independently.
  • Renewal & Expansion Safeguarding: Partner with Customer Success to conduct Value Realization Reviews (VRRs) that document proven ROI to secure high-stakes renewals and identify expansion opportunities.
  • Strategic Positioning: Contrast Unqork AI’s codeless architecture against the "AI Productivity Paradox," demonstrating how we avoid the ballooning maintenance costs of AI-generated "spaghetti code."

What U bring:

  • Experience: 5 to 10 years in Value Engineering, Management Consulting, or a highly technical Sales/Finance role within enterprise software.
  • Financial Literacy: Mastery of corporate finance principles and the ability to build complex, defensible financial models from scratch.
  • Technical Breadth: A deep understanding of enterprise software ecosystems, legacy vendor models, and the operational costs associated with traditional code-based development.
  • Strategic Execution: Proven track record in a quota-bearing or revenue-aligned environment, with an understanding of how to navigate the internal procurement and approval processes.
  • Communication: Ability to simplify complex technical architectures into clear, advantageous financial narratives for C-suite decision-makers.

Compensation, Benefits, & Perks

💻 Work from home with a remote-first community

🏝 Unlimited PTO (and the encouragement to use it)

📝 Student loan payback program

🏥 100% employer-covered medical, dental, and vision options available to you and your dependents

💸 Flexible Spending Account (FSA)

🏠 Monthly stipend toward your WFH setup, vacation, development and more

💰 Employer-sponsored 401(k) with contribution match

🏋🏻‍♀️ Subsidized ClassPass Membership

🍼 Generous Paid Parental Leave

💲 Hiring Ranges:

  • Tier 1: $148,000 - $175,000 base salary
  • Tier 2: $138,000 - $165,000 base salary

Unqork employs a market-driven approach to establish compensation ranges. In addition to a base salary, employees may also be eligible to receive a target incentive and company equity in the form of stock options.

An employee’s compensation within the range provided above depends on a variety of factors including, but not limited to, their location, role, skillset, level of experience, and similar peer salaries.

As a remote-first company, Unqork incorporates a geographic differential into our compensation structure, depending on the candidate’s location. We utilize a tiered system—Tier 1 and Tier 2—to accurately reflect local market rates and ensure our compensation packages are both fair and competitive.

Our geographic tiers are defined as follows:

  • Tier 1: New York Metro, Seattle Metro, San Francisco Bay Area
  • Tier 2: All other US and US territory locations

Unqork embraces a culture of security and privacy awareness by consistently safeguarding sensitive information, adhering to company policies, and actively participating in training and initiatives to protect our data and the privacy of our stakeholders.

Unqork is an equal opportunity employer. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age.

raw.title: Events Team Supervisor / Event Project Director (UK, Virtual, EUROPE)
raw.excerpt: About Us:At BCD Meetings & Events (BCD M&E), we provide more than meeting and event planning services: we create connections that inspire, motivate and change behavior for our customers.
raw.description:
About Us:

At BCD Meetings & Events (BCD M&E), we provide more than meeting and event planning services: we create connections that inspire, motivate and change behavior for our customers. As the world’s most trusted and innovative meetings and events agency, BCD M&E cultivates a culture of people, passion and purpose to drive business forward.

Headquartered in Chicago, with locations in 50+ countries across the world, BCD M&E’s team of 1,800+ people are committed to sustainability and driving success for our customers, our business and ourselves. Our values are at the heart of everything we do, and we look for people that want to be a part of something special, can rise to our standards and love to bring their unique perspective to the table.

While we can’t guarantee every day will be the best (who can?), we can promise a community of people who genuinely care and lead with empathy, a flexible workplace with awesome perks and challenging work that means something.

See what life is about at BCD M&E at bcdme.com/careers

About the role:

Due to internal progression our Meetings Management Life Sciences division are looking for an Events Team Supervisor / Event Project Director tojoin and lead a team. You will have expertise in end-to-end event delivery across a multitude of event formats and client industry sectors within the UK and Overseas. You thrive on delivering, collaborating across teams / departments, supporting and mentoring team members to exceed your clients’ expectations. You also get buzz and satisfaction of seeing it all come together onsite!

Sound like you? Read on!

As an Events Team Supervisor / Event Project Director , you will:

  • Lead, mentor and develop a team – including line management of Senior Event Project Managers & Project Managers
  • Ownership and day to day responsibility for the end-to-end delivery of event projects assigned to you and your team ensuring all internal / external KPI’s and SLAs are achieved
  • As part of the operations leadership team, you will collaborate with peers in resource planning including project allocation, training and development of the wider team
  • Support as required in recruitment for new team members
  • Ensure seamless service delivery and quality across multiple operational centres

You’re good at:

  • Communication – listening, written and verbal - able to interpret our client’s objectives to be delivered into all aspects of their event, help translate this to across the team
  • Previous mentoring and/or line management experience
  • Ability to instil confidence in your clients that we are experts in our field
  • Proven end to end UK and overseas event delivery experience including large scale / complex in-person and hybrid for a variety of client industry sectors
  • Proven meeting technology and delegate registration knowledge and expertise
  • Excellent attention to detail and budgeting management skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft office applications
  • Ability to react, think on your feet, offer solutions, work on multiple priorities / timelines at once
  • Ability to travel in the UK and Overseas

You might also have:

  • Experience of delivering pharmaceutical events is advantageous
  • Experience of pharmaceutical compliance is advantageous
  • Virtual meeting platform and event mobile app experience
  • Event Management degree

You should know:

  • Role is UK remote based – you will be required to go to our offices on occasion for team / company meetings
  • Our core business hours are 0900-1730 hours
  • You must have the ability to travel within the UK and Overseas, this may include weekends
  • You must have the right to work in the UK

How to apply:

Click apply now to be considered

THE PERKS

Flexible Working

We believe that a flexible working environment is key to getting the best out of our teams. We will support you to work where you need to and when you need to, depending on how you work best.

Room to Grow

Our line of work and business structure challenge our people in a way that inspires growth, with learning and development built into every role. We give individuals ownership over the direction and speed in which they grow.

Everyone has a voice

We thrive on conversations that spark curiosity and empathy. No matter how big or how small, every voice is heard, considered and respected.

Make your move

The diversity of roles across BCD M&E’s global locations means that our people often find new adventures during their time with us. Join us as a meeting planner role in the UK, stay for a global marketing career — there’s always room to move.

We’ve got you covered

Our extensive benefits include comprehensive healthcare, retirement plans, continued education support, diverse work locations, travel and hotel discounts, volunteer and sustainability opportunities and a successful employee recognition program.

We’re positive. You’ll love it.

It starts from the top. Our leaders lead with positivity, believe in our people and trust us to do the right thing. There will always be support along your journey, in little and big ways.

Job Title

Production Engineer

Department

M&MS

Permanent – Full time

Job Location

Europe

Shift Timings

8AM to 5PM (Flexible to adjust to 24*7 rotation when required to meet SLA)

Work Mode

Remote

Industry Type

Telecom OSS and BSS

Travel Required

Occasional

Why Us?

Telarix assists mobile operators worldwide to scale their Voice, SMS A2P, RCS business messaging, and application enablement services, including cloud numbers. Telarix is committed to developing the wholesale ecosystem and connecting the world’s largest operators and their partners profitably and effectively. We provide our customers with innovative automated wholesale solutions simplifying decisions and operational tasks, allowing them to strengthen existing business and discover new revenue opportunities.

Our success is built on diverse strengths across different teams, functions, and geographies summarised in our company values:

  • Open collaboration
  • Driving innovation
  • Customer commitment
  • Growth mindset
  • Deliver results.

Please visit our website to know more about us - https://telarix.com/

A Day in the Life of Production Engineer:

As a Product Engineer, you will be required to handle complex support tickets requiring deep technical expertise, particularly in SQL troubleshooting, database performance tuning, cloud infrastructure (AWS), patch management, system upgrades, and migrations. This role involves analysing and resolving critical application and database issues, optimizing performance, executing upgrades and patches, and ensuring seamless data migrations and refreshes between environments. You will also be co-ordinating with end users to provide them updates and resolve simple to complex application and environment related issues.

So, how are we going to keep you busy?

Database Administration, Maintenance & Performance Tuning

Configure and manage SQL Server databases (SSMS, SQL Administration), ensuring high availability, security, and performance.Perform database maintenance, including log file management, index rebuilding, and health monitoring to enhance performance and stability.Implement best practices for database backup, recovery, and disaster recovery planning and perform disaster recovery tests to ensure application resilience.Identify and implement process improvements and automation opportunities by reviewing repetitive maintenance tasks, configuring monitoring alerts, and proposing permanent solutions to strengthen system stability.

Patch Management & Upgrades

Analyse, prepare, and execute application patches and upgrades, ensuring minimal downtime while taking end-to-end ownership of the tasks and collaboration with customer and R&D teams to plan patch or release upgrade rollouts in non-production and production environments by following Telarix engineering best practices.Troubleshoot issues related to third-party software upgrades, patch failures, and post-upgrade performance, and document resolutions and recurring issues for future reference.

Migrations & Data Refresh

Plan and execute data refreshes between different environments (e.g., UAT, Staging, Production), database migrations across on-premises, cloud (AWS, Azure), and hybrid environments.Provision and manage AWS-hosted database infrastructure, including EC2, EBS, and backup/restore processes and optimize resource utilization, scaling, and performance tuning for cloud-based applications.

Technical Support

Lead customer communication and provide regular updates on issue resolution, collaborating closely with internal teams such as R&D and Pre-Sales.Diagnose and troubleshoot SQL Server, Windows, and database performance issues, including query optimization, deadlocks, blocking, and bottlenecks.

What will make you eligible for this role?

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, or related field.5+ years of experience in technical support, engineering support, or database administration.

Experience, that will be an advantage:

Proven experience in customer support, preferably in a global environment.Strong experience in Windows, Linux, Microsoft SQL Server, SQL, SSMS.Experience in patch management, software upgrades, and database migrations.Hands-on experience with AWS configuring and monitoring (EC2, EBS, S3, IAM, backup & recovery strategies).Hands on experience with MicroStrategy, Python, and Docker instances

What will make you the best-fit for this role?

Database Administration skills (backup, maintenance plans, indexing, security).Troubleshooting skills for diagnosing performance issues, query tuning, and system bottlenecks.Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data-driven decision-making.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Experience in root cause analysis (RCA) and providing long-term fixes.Strong documentation and communication skills.Certification in SQL, Microsoft technologies and/or AWS are a plus.

Limitation and Disclaimer:

The aforementioned job description is aimed to provide an overview of the overall type and level of work being performed for this role; it shouldn't be interpreted as a complete list of all obligations, responsibilities, and qualifications needed for the job.

In no way does this job description imply or say that these are the exclusive responsibilities of the employee holding this position. Any additional job-related instructions or tasks that are requested by the manager must be completed by the employee.

Ready, set, apply!

raw.description:
Our Team

Global Customer Value (CARE) Our global CARE team has been critical in delivering best in class service committed and focused on providing exceptional experiences for our customers. They create lasting impressions and building authentic relationships with a wide range of small business owners each day. As a Technical Program Manager, you will be able to influence cross-functional teams to design innovative consumer products and release new features in Vista mobile and web applications. Maturity, high judgement, technical skills, ability to influence, analytical talent, and leadership are needed to succeed in this role.

What You Will Do

  • Lead large-scale, company-wide, highly cross-functional projects to deliver against the strategic goals of the Continuous Improvement team.

  • Define and lead project scope, plan/achievements, dependencies, and risks.

  • Lead continuous improvement projects that have a measurable impact on the business. Coordinate and lead all project communications and meetings–keeping all team members apprised of project status, next steps/actions, impediments, and potential risks and/or trade-offs.

  • Prepare and deliver status updates to the senior management team regarding progress to key performance indicator targets.

  • Analyse historical and segmentation data to identify trends and insights to identify potential focus areas for the team.

  • Evaluate, recommending, and implementing opportunities to improve internal processes and tools to improve delivery excellence.

  • Deliver results that meet individual and team goals.

  • Work with subject matter experts to lead and drive new technology initiatives and evaluations.

  • Develop and champion processes for efficiency and scale in our organization.

Your Qualifications

At VistaPrint, we are striving to hire individuals that add new ideas and perspectives to our teams and enhance our culture. No matter your background or work experience, we strongly encourage you to apply—even if you feel that you don’t meet the exact requirements or have the same qualifications. You might be a great candidate for this or other opportunities.

  • 5+ years of experience in project management and 2+ years of technical program management experience

  • Strong project management skills, inclusive of prioritizing requirements, identify achievements/dependencies, remove blockers and lead risk & impact.

  • Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules.

  • Experience with project management software tools (i.e.: JIRA, Trello, Slack, etc.) as well as Microsoft Excel and reporting tools (i.e., Tableau, Looker, Quicksight, etc.).

  • Experience with Lean, Operation Excellence, or Six Sigma methodologies.

Nice to Have

  • Experience working in an agile project management environment is a strong plus.

Why You'll Love Working Here

There is a lot to love about working at VistaPrint. We are an award winning Remote-First company. We’re an inclusive community. We’re growing (which means you can too). And to help orient us all in the same direction, we have our Vista Behaviors which exemplify the behavioral attributes that make us a culturally strong and high-performing team.

About Us

VistaPrint is the design and marketing partner to millions of small businesses around the world. For over 20 years we’ve been inspired by small businesses, and we work incessantly to deliver solutions to their evolving needs. Together, VistaCreate, 99designs by Vista and VistaPrint represent a full-service design, digital and print solution, elevating small businesses’ presence in physical and digital spaces and powering them to achieve success. VistaPrint is focused on making great marketing and design accessible to every small business owner, allowing them to create a cohesive brand image for use in-store, online and on-the-go.

Commitment to Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

VistaPrint exists to help our customers live their dreams. Each dream is unique – and the VistaPrint team needs to be as well. We believe in the unique contributions of everyone within a diverse global organization. We are collaborative, inclusive, and innovative. We strive to role model and live an inclusive culture of fairness, respect and belonging for all. And we work together to empower each other, creating a space in which each of us can spark our next great idea.

Equal Opportunity Employer

VistaPrint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

raw.description:
Primary Function of Position:

The U.S. ION® Endoluminal Territory Associate reports to the U.S. ION® Endoluminal Program Manager (EPM). The ION® Endoluminal Territory Associate plays a critical role in the early adoption of the Ion® platform in expanding access to minimally invasive care for lung biopsy. This individual will be primarily focused on supporting early sustainable users and programs and the development of KOL’s and programs that can highlight the early clinical, economic and strategic value of ION®.

Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Provide procedural support to new users to promote safety and effective progression through their learning curves
  • Support training activities to include in-services, training labs, attend first case series and development of teams and programs
  • Become a clinical expert in the pulmonary oncology space
  • Work alongside Endoluminal Sales Representatives to collaborate with senior hospital staff and key physicians in the development and execution of a plan to effectively integrate Ion® at new customer sites, ensuring ongoing commitment to and utilization of the system
  • Facilitate critical user and procedural data capture to create effective QTI and benchmarking metrics
  • Collaboration with daVinci local sales teams to ensure consistent alignment and communication with internal and external stakeholders
  • Responsibly manage administrative tasks, SFDC management, submission of expense reports, etc.

Skills, Experience, Education, & Training

  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • A minimum of 1 year sales experience, leadership experience or clinical experience
  • Demonstrated ability to manage complexity and work in an environment of change
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to excel in a high-energy, fast-paced environment
  • Ability to travel up to 60% and located near a major airline hub
  • Knowledge of the Pulmonology/Bronchoscopy space environment is a plus

Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role.

Intuitive is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.

Mandatory Notices

U.S. Export Controls Disclaimer: In accordance with the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (15 CFR §743.13(b)), some roles at Intuitive Surgical may be subject to U.S. export controls for prospective employees who are nationals from countries currently on embargo or sanctions status.

Certain information you provide as part of the application will be used for purposes of determining whether Intuitive Surgical will need to (i) obtain an export license from the U.S. Government on your behalf (note: the government’s licensing process can take 3 to 6+ months) or (ii) implement a Technology Control Plan (“TCP”) (note: typically adds 2 weeks to the hiring process).

For any Intuitive role subject to export controls, final offers are contingent upon obtaining an approved export license and/or an executed TCP prior to the prospective employee’s start date, which may or may not be flexible, and within a timeframe that does not unreasonably impede the hiring need. If applicable, candidates will be notified and instructed on any requirements for these purposes.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

We provide market-competitive compensation packages, inclusive of base pay + commission, benefits, and equity. The on target earnings for this position are listed.

At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.
As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible.

Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.

Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.

Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care.

description: OverviewC’est grâce à plus de 11000 employés répartis sur plus de 100 sites, que Bruker rend possible les découvertes révolutionnaires faites par les scientifiques et de développer de nouvelles applications améliorant la qualité de la vie humaine au quotidien.

raw.title: Field Service Engineer
raw.excerpt: OverviewC’est grâce à plus de 11000 employés répartis sur plus de 100 sites, que Bruker rend possible les découvertes révolutionnaires faites par les scientifiques et de développer de nouvelles applications améliorant la qualité de la vie humaine au quotidien.
raw.description:
Overview

C’est grâce à plus de 11000 employés répartis sur plus de 100 sites, que Bruker rend possible les découvertes révolutionnaires faites par les scientifiques et de développer de nouvelles applications améliorant la qualité de la vie humaine au quotidien.

La division Bruker Nano Surfaces (BNS) fait partie de Bruker Corporation (www.bruker.com), l'un des principaux fournisseurs mondiaux d'instrumentation scientifique. La division BNS recherche un(e) ingénieur(e) service après-ventes sur le terrain pour fournir une assistance sur site à nos clients d'instruments de métrologie en Europe. Vous ferez partie de l'équipe de service EMEA, qui fournit un support pour une large gamme d'outils de métrologie, notamment des instruments en nano mécaniques, les profilomètres optique 3D, les profilomètres à stylet et un des instruments de mesure en nano chimie.

Vous interviendrez chez le client pour mettre en place, dépanner ou déménager l'instrument ou le système en respectant les règles de sécurité. Vous mènerez à bien l’intervention en vous assurant de la bonne réception et de la satisfaction du client.

Responsibilities

  • Préparer l'installation en prenant connaissance des spécifications techniques du système et de s'assurer des pré-requis techniques et matériels en interne et avec le client afin de mener à bien l'installation dans les délais impartis
  • Réaliser l'installation sur site d'un système et la formation de prise en main auprès du client afin de réaliser la mise en service conformément au cahier des charges
  • Réaliser la maintenance régulière et/ou préventive selon le protocole défini pour le système concerné afin de répondre à des critères de conformité ou contractuels envers le client
  • Diagnostiquer et corriger sur site et/ou par prise en main à distance, les dysfonctionnements sur les systèmes afin de remettre le système en état opérationnel
  • Assurer un suivi régulier et entretenir une relation de qualité avec le client afin de pérenniser les relations commerciales
  • Rédiger un rapport d'activités externe et interne et réaliser le reporting dans le logiciel métier dédié afin de s'assurer de la traçabilité de l'activité et de la bonne imputation des coûts
  • Faire le lien entre les experts de l'usine et le client afin de résoudre les problématiques complexes
  • Assurer le suivi des contrats de maintenance
  • Établir un lien de confiance afin de devenir une interface efficace entre le client et Bruker pour assurer la satisfaction du client et permettre la vente de contrats de services et de nouveaux équipements.

Qualifications

  • Vous avez de bonnes connaissances en génie mécanique/électrique ou science des matériaux
  • Vous possédez de solides compétences en communication
  • Vous avez une capacité à comprendre des systèmes électromécaniques complexes et de bonnes compétences en résolution de problèmes techniques
  • Vous avez une première expérience dans l'utilisation d'outils tels qu'un oscilloscope et un multimètre
  • Une expérience existante avec des instruments nano mécaniques, l'interférométrie à lumière blanche, les profileurs optiques 3D et/ou le profileur de stylet serait un plus
  • Vous êtes capable de dépanner et de résoudre les problèmes de manière indépendante ainsi que d'animer des formations
  • Bonnes connaissances en informatique
  • Anglais courant
  • Permis de conduire en cours de validité dans l'UE/Royaume-Uni

Ce que nous vous offrons :

  • Un environnement de travail agréable et convivial
  • Des opportunités de formation
  • La possibilité de télétravailler
  • Une prévoyance et mutuelle
  • Un CSE
  • Un restaurant d’entreprise
  • Une équipe joyeuse, ouverte et qui va de l'avant, composée de collaborateurs passionnés

Vous cherchez à évoluer dans un milieu agile, prônant l’innovation, et faites preuve d’un vif intérêt pour les technologies de pointe ? Alors, nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature!

title: Network Engineer (DDoS Protection)
description: What You’ll Do• Analyzing network traffic, diverting, assessing, filtering, and redesigning solutions tailored to meet specific client needs, while provisioning customers on DDoS tooling.

raw.title: Network Engineer (DDoS Protection)
raw.excerpt: What You’ll Do• Analyzing network traffic, diverting, assessing, filtering, and redesigning solutions tailored to meet specific client needs, while provisioning customers on DDoS tooling.
raw.description:
What You’ll Do

  • Analyzing network traffic, diverting, assessing, filtering, and redesigning solutions tailored to meet specific client needs, while provisioning customers on DDoS tooling.
  • Responding promptly and effectively to DDoS-related incidents impacting production network services in a 24/7 operational environment.
  • Proactively monitoring traffic patterns and fine-tuning mitigation thresholds to enhance protection measures. Collaborating in the design and implementation of strategies and architectures that strengthen Gcore's secure cyber infrastructure.
  • Providing 24/7 on-call support on a rotational basis, including weekends and holidays.
  • Partnering with cross-functional operations and engineering teams to maintain and advance a secure network environment.

What We’re Looking For

  • Hands-on experience with DDoS detection, analysis, and mitigation in large-scale networking environments, with a preference for a global ISP
  • Experience with Unix-based systems administration
  • In-depth Network Operating Systems/Administration knowledge & experience (Cisco XR/XE, Arista EOS, Junos, SROS)
  • Experience with network automation using Python Technical Skills:
  • Network Fundamentals: A deep understanding of network protocols such as TCP/IP, BGP, and OSPF
  • DDoS Protection: stateful and stateless protection measures always-on and on-demand protection, remotely triggered blackhole routing, bgp flowspec.
  • Programming & Automation Tools: Familiarity with data-serialization language (YAML, JSON), template engines (jinja2). Familiarity with git and CI/CD tools.
  • Knowledge of monitoring solutions (Prometheus, Grafana).
  • Fluent English

Nice to Have

  • Experience working for DDoS protection providers.
  • Familiarity with anti-DDOS protection solutions (Cloudflare, Arbor, Radware, Akamai)
  • Good teamwork and problem-solving abilities.

Benefits

At Gcore, we want you to do your best work and enjoy the journey. Our benefits are designed to support your growth, well-being, and life beyond work:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible working hours
  • Remote, hybrid, or office work options depending on your role
  • Work from anywhere in the world for up to 45 days per year
  • Private medical insurance for you and your family*
  • 5 additional vacation days*
  • Additional fully paid sick leave days*
  • Allowance for significant life events and birthdays
  • Language classes
  • Modern office space with free snacks, drink and entertainment options*
  • Team sports activities*

*Please be aware that this benefit may vary depending on your country.

Equal Opportunity Employer

We provide equal opportunity to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.

The world’s digital experiences run on something invisible: the infrastructure and software that keep them fast, reliable, and secure. At Gcore, you’ll help design and deliver that foundation for an AI-driven world.

We’re a global provider of infrastructure and software solutions for AI, cloud, network, and security, powering everything from real-time communication and streaming to enterprise AI and secure web applications. With 210+ edge locations, 50+ cloud regions, and thousands of GPUs, your work here can reach users and businesses across the globe.

You’ll collaborate with leading technology partners such as Intel, NVIDIA, Dell, and Equinix, and work on platforms that power digital products used around the world. Our vision is simple: to connect the world to AI, anywhere, anytime.

Want to work on technology that goes beyond a single product or industry? Join a global team of 550+ professionals building infrastructure and software that supports the entire digital ecosystem.

We are currently looking for a skilled Network Engineer to join our DDoS Protection team. In this role, you will play a key part in supporting our security products, with a focus on Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protection.

raw.description:
Our Team

As an e-commerce powerhouse, VistaPrint is a dynamic organization that fosters an exciting and entrepreneurial culture. Empowering and helping businesses is our core focus, with an emphasis on creating customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. The VistaPrint Corporate Solutions team develops self-service platforms for small to mid-sized businesses, enabling them to offer an in-house digital storefront featuring up to 40,000 unique products. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation, and growth – for both our customers and our team.

About the Role

We’re seeking a driven Account Executive with a positive and winning attitude to join our team. In this role, you will qualify inbound leads and strive to win quality partnerships. This is an exciting opportunity for individuals seeking to advance their careers in Sales.

What You Will Do

  • Prospect and qualify new clients that employ 20-500 office workers across various industries, utilizing phone and video demonstrations.
  • Build and maintain a sales pipeline to hit monthly targets.
  • Present to and consultatively sell to C-Suite executives, Purchasing Managers, Office Managers, Owners, and individuals who purchase print materials and promotional items on behalf of the organization.
  • Provide a smooth transition from first interaction to customer agreement to account handoff to our Account Management Teams.
  • Work with sales leadership, marketing, and product teams to identify industry trends and prioritize customer feedback.

Your Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Business, Marketing, Communications, or another related field.
  • 1-3 years of sales-related experience.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work well both independently and in a team setting.
  • A self-motivated, strong influencing, results-oriented mindset.
  • Experience in a fast-paced environment.
  • Pay attention to details.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in German and English are a must.

Nice to Have

  • Previous sales or marketing internship experience is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Salesforce.com and/or ability to learn new systems quickly.
  • Trained in sales methodologies such as Sandler or Challenger

Why You'll Love Working Here

There is a lot to love about working at VistaPrint. We are an award-winning Remote-First company. We’re an inclusive community. We’re growing (which means you can too). And to help orient us all in the same direction, our Vista Behaviors exemplify the behavioral attributes that make us a culturally strong and high-performing team.

About Us

VistaPrint is the design and marketing partner to millions of small businesses worldwide. For over 20 years, we’ve been inspired by small businesses, and we work incessantly to deliver solutions to their evolving needs. Together, VistaCreate, 99designs by Vista, and VistaPrint represent a comprehensive design, digital, and print solution, elevating small businesses’ presence in both physical and digital spaces and empowering them to succeed. VistaPrint is focused on making great marketing and design accessible to every small business owner, allowing them to create a cohesive brand image for use in-store, online, and on the go.

Commitment to Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

VistaPrint exists to help our customers live their dreams. Each dream is unique, and the VistaPrint team needs to be as well. We believe in everyone's unique contributions to a diverse global organization. We are a collaborative, inclusive, and innovative team. We strive to be role models and live an inclusive culture of fairness, respect, and belonging for all. And we work together to empower each other, creating a space in which each of us can spark our next great idea.

Equal Opportunity Employer

VistaPrint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive; in fact, we often strive to do more than the law requires in many cases.

raw.description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)
Work Schedule: Full-Time, Philippine Time (12 AM to 9 AM PHT, Tuesday to Saturday)

Must have prior experience working with U.S. clients

About CoreBridge Solutions

CoreBridge Solutions is a trusted outsourcing and digital innovation partner for United States-based firms. We help organizations improve operations through modern platforms, streamlined workflows, and strong execution. We support industries such as legal, real estate, finance, marketing, and field service to create efficient systems that drive measurable results.

Our approach is grounded in technology, operational excellence, and continuous improvement. We build systems and processes that help clients scale and operate more effectively.

Position Overview

We are looking for a System Implementation Manager who can take real operational needs and translate them into well-built, reliable system workflows. You will primarily support the implementation, configuration, and integration of our field service and customer relationship platforms.

You will work closely with operations, leadership, and field teams to turn business requirements into practical system setups, clean data structures, and clear workflows.

You will work with:

  • Zuper for FSM scheduling, dispatch, work orders, inventory, and asset tracking
  • HubSpot for CRM, sales, service, and customer lifecycle management

You will focus on implementing configurations, building automations, improving processes, and helping users adopt these tools smoothly.

Success in this role means keeping data accurate, improving workflow efficiency, and ensuring teams can rely on Zuper and HubSpot to support daily operations.

Key Responsibilities

System Implementation and Configuration

  • Configure Zuper and HubSpot based on business requirements, including fields, workflows, automations, and dashboards.
  • Support testing, UAT, and go-live activities for new processes or integrations.

Integrations and Data Flow

  • Support integrations between Zuper, HubSpot, and other platforms to keep data consistent and accurate.
  • Document integration logic and field mappings for clear future maintainability.

Process Documentation and Workflow Improvement

  • Assist in mapping and improving operational workflows such as scheduling, call-to-cash, preventative maintenance, and service delivery.
  • Ensure processes are clearly documented with diagrams, checklists, and written procedures.

Data Migration and Data Quality

  • Support data migration efforts including extraction, cleansing, mapping, and validation of customer, asset, and service data.

Training and User Support

  • Deliver training to office staff and field teams on how to use the systems effectively.
  • Create simple playbooks and guides to help users adopt new features.

Collaboration and Continuous Improvement

  • Work closely with leadership and operational teams to understand requirements and help prioritize system enhancements.
  • Monitor system performance and recommend improvements.

Your Profile

Required Skills and Experience

  • Three or more years experience implementing or supporting FSM, ERP, or CRM systems such as Zuper, ServiceMax, Salesforce, Acumatica, or similar.
  • Hands-on experience configuring HubSpot CRM, including workflows, automation, and custom properties or objects.
  • Experience working with ERP systems (Acumatica experience preferred but not required).
  • Understanding of API integrations and how data flows across multiple systems.
  • Ability to map and document business processes with clarity.
  • Strong project coordination, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Experience implementing Zuper or another FSM platform.
  • Background in field service work such as HVAC, commercial refrigeration, or appliance repair.
  • Experience training field or non-technical users.

Why Join CoreBridge Solutions

At CoreBridge, you’ll be part of a company that values innovation and efficiency, with a track record of transforming industry standards in a collaborative, fast-paced environment. Our team consists of passionate individuals who strive to provide solutions that not only meet but exceed our customers' expectations. Join us and contribute to our mission to redefine the property management landscape, one project at a time.

Benefits

  • Opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the Philippines.
  • Performance-related bonuses celebrating significant milestones.
  • A genuine commitment to maintaining a healthy work-life balance with a 40-hour workweek.

Work Environment Notice

CoreBridge Solutions is dedicated to maintaining a productive, safe, and efficient work environment for all team members. To support this commitment, we use a live monitoring system during working hours. By applying for this position, you acknowledge and accept this monitoring process as part of your role. This system helps us ensure a supportive and effective work environment for everyone.

How to Apply

Ready to make an impact? Please fill out the application form and upload your CV in PDF format. We look forward to learning more about you and how you can contribute to our team.

raw.title: Business Analyst with elicitation and documentation, gap analysis, and testing.
raw.excerpt: JOB DESCRIPTION: The Business Analyst (BA) performs business analysis work to support the Compliance and Quality Control Division's Solicitation Review System's re-write project.
raw.description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

The Business Analyst (BA) performs business analysis work to support the Compliance and Quality Control Division's Solicitation Review System's re-write project. This role partners with business owners throughout product planning, requirements definition, and delivery cycles. Responsibilities include analyzing complex technical and business processes, identifying efficiencies, and prioritizing needs. The BA coordinates the gathering, development, documentation, and verification (testing) of requirements and works under limited supervision with considerable latitude for initiative and independent judgment.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Elicit and document business requirements for the existing Solicitation Review System, ensuring accuracy and effective communication with stakeholders and the development team. Responsible for coordinating, scheduling, and leading all requirements-gathering meetings. (40%)

Conduct gap analysis of existing system functionality against desired system functionality for the Solicitation Review System, including workflows and reporting through PowerBI. (20%)

Collaborate daily with the Senior Systems Advisor to track the development and implementation of requirements and test new and existing system functionality for adherence to business requirements for the Solicitation Review System. Update and maintain requirements documentation throughout the life of the project. (30%)

Report weekly to the Director of Contract Compliance Unit regarding progress, potential issues, and overall status. (10%)

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS and ABILITIES:

Knowledge of BABOK Guide principles, including elicitation, requirements analysis, and validation.

Knowledge of gap analysis methodologies—comparing current state vs. desired state and identifying missing capabilities.

Knowledge of the capabilities and limitations of computer systems or management information systems.

Knowledge of process or systems analysis and design work.

Knowledge of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)

Skill i-n defining all types of requirements, functional specifications, and other deliverables.

Skill in policy interpretation and translating regulations into system requirements.

Skill in requirements elicitation techniques such as techniques such as interviews, workshops, document analysis, observation, and surveys.

Skill in working collaboratively and cooperatively with colleagues and in building consensus.

Skill in interpersonal relationships, including the ability to work with people under pressure, negotiate among multiple parties, resolve conflicts, and establish and maintain effective working relationships with various levels of personnel in governmental entities.

Skill in troubleshooting, performance tuning, and problem-solving.

Skill in verbal, written, and presentation communication.

Skill in Microsoft Excel.

Ability to create clear, complete, and actionable requirements documentation.

Ability to build consensus across multiple teams.

Ability to ensure accuracy in documenting system functionality and regulatory requirements.

Ability to identify compliance gaps and propose feasible solutions.

Ability to adapt effectively to evolving regulations and system complexities.

Ability to build trust and maintain relationships across technical and business teams.

Regards,

Mohammed ilyas,

PH - 229-264-4024 or Text - 229-469-1455 or you can share the updated resume at Mohammed@vtekis. com

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

raw.title: Intern - Talent Acquisition Partner
raw.excerpt: HEY THERE!  We are Mercedes-Benz. io.  Our mission is to ignite and build the digital solutions for Mercedes-Benz by forming a tribe of digital enthusiasts that drive Mercedes-Benz digital future.
raw.description:
HEY THERE!

We are Mercedes-Benz.io. Our mission is to ignite and build the digital solutions for Mercedes-Benz by forming a tribe of digital enthusiasts that drive Mercedes-Benz digital future.

Therefore, we offer you flexibility! You can choose to work hybrid from our offices in Lisbon or Braga, or remotely from any location in mainland Portugal. Nonetheless, our tribe is our beating heart so we often organize company events and gatherings to bring MB.ioneers together. While some are optional, we would require your presence for certain team events and/or occasions.

We don’t care about your shoes, as long as you are wearing the right attitude. At Mercedes-Benz.io we walk the talk and make things happen. We do not digitize for the sake of being digital but for a better tomorrow for our customers. That’s not our job; it’s our passion. Therefore, we love to reflect and challenge everything – the status quo, Mercedes-Benz, and ourselves. We share the same beliefs and stand up for each other and this is why we hire unique people to join our Tribe of digital enthusiasts.

IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL

  • Support candidate sourcing, screening, and interview coordination, while learning how to ensure a fair and inclusive process.

  • Assist in maintaining and improving recruitment processes, gaining exposure to data-driven insights and best practices.

  • Collaborate with recruiters and hiring managers to understand role requirements and hiring needs.

  • Help with talent research and basic market insights to support recruitment strategies.

  • Support candidate communication by scheduling interviews, sharing updates, and contributing to a positive candidate experience.

  • Assist with offer preparation and onboarding coordination in collaboration with People Ops, IT, and other teams.

  • Support employer branding initiatives such as events, partnerships, and career fairs.

Requirements

TO SUCCEED YOU NEED

  • Interest in Talent Acquisition, HR, or People & Culture, ideally supported by studies in HR, Psychology, Business, or a related field.

  • First practical experience (internships, student jobs, or projects) in recruitment, HR, or similar areas is a plus.

  • Curiosity to learn full-cycle recruitment and exposure to technical and non-technical roles.

  • Basic familiarity with recruitment tools or platforms (e.g. ATS, LinkedIn) is an advantage, but not required.

  • Good communication skills in English (verbal and written).

  • A collaborative mindset and willingness to learn from different stakeholders.

  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

  • Motivation to contribute to employer branding and candidate experience.

YOU WILL BE HAPPY WITH

  • Colleagues that are as smart, hardworking and driven as you

  • Work equipment (MacBook Pro or Dell, your choice) and noise-cancelling headphones

  • An amazing open-minded and informal culture with the backup of a giant company like Mercedes-Benz

  • Health insurance

  • Proactive self-development in international Trainings and Conferences

  • Language Training courses

  • Wellbeing actions (massages, nutrition sessions, happy hour and more)

  • Brand Connection Perks

  • Learning and development opportunities throughout your internship

  • Much more cool stuff

THIS IS WHAT OUR PROCESS LOOKS LIKE

  • Screening call with our Recruiter to get to know your motivation and interests

  • Interview with the team

  • Final conversation

  • Offer

WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO KNOW ABOUT US

Mercedes-Benz.io develops software and technology for the digital platforms of Mercedes-Benz. Our main products are the Mercedes-Benz Website worldwide, the e-commerce platform, digital services and aftersales solutions.

We have a fantastic team with people from all over the world. We encourage frequent collaboration and pairing across disciplines. English is the main working language.

Mercedes-Benz.io is an equal opportunities employer. We believe that diverse experiences and a broad collective perspective lead to a better company culture and better products.

Interested in engaging with a continuously evolving company to work hard, play hard and party hard?

If so, please send your resumé (in English and PDF).

title: Lead Application Security Engineer, Vista Technology - Spain Remote (ES)
description: Our TeamVista Security is a global team that ensures that security risks are identified and managed, and that customer trust is maintained by creating a culture of security in which engineers are empowered via standards, tools, processes, and training to proactively address security issues.

raw.title: Lead Application Security Engineer, Vista Technology - Spain Remote (ES)
raw.excerpt: Our TeamVista Security is a global team that ensures that security risks are identified and managed, and that customer trust is maintained by creating a culture of security in which engineers are empowered via standards, tools, processes, and training to proactively address security issues.
raw.description:
Our Team

Vista Security is a global team that ensures that security risks are identified and managed, and that customer trust is maintained by creating a culture of security in which engineers are empowered via standards, tools, processes, and training to proactively address security issues. We foster a collaborative environment that embraces security without hindering speed and innovation while providing visibility into security risks and ensuring appropriate mitigation controls exist.

What You Will Do

  • Develop and implement automation for tooling to integrate security tools to improve stakeholder experience
  • Define and track key metrics to measure compliance with security standards, and create reports for various stakeholders
  • Conduct vulnerability assessments and provide actionable recommendations for remediation in applications
  • Manage and maintain security tools, including those for static and dynamic code analysis and vulnerability scanning
  • Support Engineering teams in risk identification and remediation, including security architecture reviews and threat modeling
  • Contribute to the development of security policies and standards, and ensure their effective implementation
  • Independently deliver and/or collaborate on the preparation of reports, briefings, and documentation
  • Recommend best practices for cloud security, especially Web Application Firewall rules

Your Qualifications

At VistaPrint, we are striving to hire individuals that add new ideas and perspectives to our teams and enhance our culture. No matter your background or work experience, we strongly encourage you to apply—even if you feel that you don’t meet the exact requirements or have the same qualifications. You might be a great candidate for this or other opportunities.

  • 5+ year experience in Application Security
  • Track record of delivering technical projects, and implementing security products in a highly technical environment
  • Proven experience with web application security and microservice architecture
  • Hands-on experience with one major Cloud Infrastructure platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and Web Application Firewall (WAF) principles
  • Proficiency in Python required. Additional programming or scripting languages such as JavaScript, PowerShell, or Bash are considered a plus
  • Experience creating data visualizations and reports using tools like Snowflake and Looker, with a foundational understanding of SQL
  • Advanced understanding of cybersecurity principles, tools, and techniques

Nice to Have

  • Effective Communication both verbally and in writing
  • Detail-oriented, critical thinker who excels both in collaboration and independent work
  • Relevant industry certifications from SANS, ISC2, etc.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related ﬁeld
  • Understanding of compliance standards and data regulation requirements strongly preferred
  • Previous experience working with peers asynchronously

Why You'll Love Working Here

There is a lot to love about working at VistaPrint. We are an award winning Remote-First company. We’re an inclusive community. We’re growing (which means you can too). And to help orient us all in the same direction, we have our Vista Behaviors which exemplify the behavioral attributes that make us a culturally strong and high-performing team.

About Us

VistaPrint is the design and marketing partner to millions of small businesses around the world. For over 20 years we’ve been inspired by small businesses, and we work incessantly to deliver solutions to their evolving needs. Together, VistaCreate, 99designs by Vista and VistaPrint represent a full-service design, digital and print solution, elevating small businesses’ presence in physical and digital spaces and powering them to achieve success. VistaPrint is focused on making great marketing and design accessible to every small business owner, allowing them to create a cohesive brand image for use in-store, online and on-the-go.

Commitment to Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

VistaPrint exists to help our customers live their dreams. Each dream is unique – and the VistaPrint team needs to be as well. We believe in the unique contributions of everyone within a diverse global organization. We are collaborative, inclusive, and innovative. We strive to role model and live an inclusive culture of fairness, respect and belonging for all. And we work together to empower each other, creating a space in which each of us can spark our next great idea.

Equal Opportunity Employer

VistaPrint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

title: Sales & Business Development Associate
description: Bridge the Worlds of Private Equity and Cloud Innovation — Become nClouds’ PE Channel Sales Associate The Sales & Business Development Associate is a United States based hybrid role blending private equity market intelligence, AWS PE alliance support, and go-to-market execution.

raw.title: Sales & Business Development Associate
raw.excerpt: Bridge the Worlds of Private Equity and Cloud Innovation — Become nClouds’ PE Channel Sales Associate The Sales & Business Development Associate is a United States based hybrid role blending private equity market intelligence, AWS PE alliance support, and go-to-market execution.
raw.description:
Bridge the Worlds of Private Equity and Cloud Innovation — Become nClouds’ PE Channel Sales Associate

The Sales & Business Development Associate is a United States based hybrid role blending private equity market intelligence, AWS PE alliance support, and go-to-market execution. You will research PE firms, map portfolio structures, enable tailored sales engagement, and coordinate events and partnerships that strengthen nClouds’ footprint across the PE ecosystem. This is a high-visibility, cross-functional role partnering closely with sales leadership, marketing, PE groups, portfolio companies, and AWS’s Private Equity team.

Key Responsibilities

  • Build detailed profiles on PE firms (fund size, portfolio mix, investment themes, technology maturity, AWS usage).
  • Map fund structures and key stakeholders: PE firm → portfolio companies → executives & value creation leaders.
  • Track portfolio news including deals, exits, leadership changes, and major technology initiatives.
  • Maintain a central intelligence dashboard to guide outreach and strategy.
  • Collaborate on customized decks, one-pagers, and sales playbooks tailored to fund value-creation priorities.
  • Assist with business cases, TCO models, and modernization roadmaps for portfolio company opportunities.
  • Capture post-engagement success metrics and help build repeatable “Portfolio Proof Points.”
  • Align with the AWS Private Equity Team on target groups, co-sell motions, and funding programs.
  • Support coordination of AWS meetings, events, and GTM activities.
  • Track AWS incentives and partner-influenced pipeline.
  • Support planning and logistics for PE roundtables, webinars, and AWS co-events.
  • Manage invitations, attendance tracking, and follow-up campaigns.
  • Assist in developing event content and distributing collateral.
  • Maintain accurate CRM data for PE firms and portfolios.
  • Build dashboards tracking pipeline, fund penetration, and engagement metrics.
  • Deliver monthly insights for leadership and board reporting.

Requirements

  • 2–4 years in sales operations, business development, or partner enablement within technology services, SaaS, or consulting.
  • Exposure to private equity or PE-backed companies preferred.
  • Experience with AWS or other hyperscaler partner programs a plus.
  • Strong research and market-mapping capabilities.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proficiency with Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Excel/Sheets.
  • Strong organizational and project management ability.
  • Ability to create polished collateral using PowerPoint, Google Slides, Canva, or similar tools.
  • Business-savvy, curious, and financially literate — understands PE value creation.
  • Self-starter who anticipates needs and takes ownership.
  • Excited about the intersection of cloud, AI, and private equity transformation
Salary: 80,000 - 90,000

title: Technical Account Manager
description: Summary of RoleV-Key is one of the world’s leading deep-tech companies in mobile cyber-security.

raw.title: Technical Account Manager
raw.excerpt: Summary of RoleV-Key is one of the world’s leading deep-tech companies in mobile cyber-security.
raw.description:
Summary of Role

V-Key is one of the world’s leading deep-tech companies in mobile cyber-security. Our patented technology V-OS has been deployed by top banks, mobile payment providers, and governments to secure software solutions and protect more than 100 million users globally.

We are rapidly expanding into new markets and new customer segments. Apart from securing digital transactions for everyone, we are also enabling new generation technology by providing the cyber-security infrastructure for banking, government and smart homes, among many others.

At V-Key, we are building towards a future where technology users can enjoy unprecedented security and convenience.

We are looking for a Technical Account Manager who will manage a team to support customers in Thailand. The successful candidate will drive technical activities proactively, as well as be the customer's technical go-to person for any technical related questions.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Act as the primary point-of-contact for all technical activities and incidents post launch for assigned customer
  • Work closely with legal and finance teams to create the new contracts and renewal of the existing customer contracts.
  • Provide technical support for customers to support pre-sales and post-sales processes
  • Conduct regular technical account reviews, architectural reviews, product trainings and workshops, providing insights and analytics
  • Be an expert in V-Key’s products and the underlying architecture and provide effective technical consultation to customer
  • Responsible for managing the team’s day-to-day operational and ensuring that the team follows the customer implementation process and V-Key’s Internal Process through an assigned Service Delivery Manager
  • Ensure deliveries/patches delivered on time with good quality
  • Analyse customer needs and suggest upgrades or additional features to meet their requirements and demands
  • Ensure Service Delivery Manager facilitates incident, problem and change management to ensure all reported issues are resolved as per pre-defined SLA
  • Work closely with customer’s internal IT team to plan and align V-Key’s resources with the road map and timeline
  • Work closely with V-Key’s product team to communicate product new releases to customer
  • Prepare and submit periodical report for all Incidents with the defect details with the status to customer
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (ie. internal product development, QA, Customer support and Customer Technical team) to resolve incidents and problems through Service Delivery Manager

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Computer Science or related field
  • Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience as a Technical Account Manager or Project Manager roles
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience managing a team
  • Experience in managing external customers, preferably in the banking/ financial sector
  • Solid technical background with understanding of mobile/ web application technologies in software development is preferred
  • Knowledge in server side architecture, application servers and related databases is a plus
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills: spoken and written English and Thai is preferred to better support the I Thailand market
  • Ability to work in a dynamic, fast moving and growing environment
  • Ability to learn and adopt new knowledge on cyber security domain
  • Ability to balance the internal teams and customers on setting the right delivery schedules Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
  • Team player with great interpersonal and communication skills

title: Account Executive Netherlands
description: At Azumuta, we are seeking a dynamic Account Executive to drive enterprise growth and secure high-value partnerships with mid-market & large enterprises in the Netherlands.

raw.title: Account Executive Netherlands
raw.excerpt: At Azumuta, we are seeking a dynamic Account Executive to drive enterprise growth and secure high-value partnerships with mid-market & large enterprises in the Netherlands.
raw.description:
At Azumuta, we are seeking a dynamic Account Executive to drive enterprise growth and secure high-value partnerships with mid-market & large enterprises in the Netherlands. You’ll take ownership of the full sales cycle, from prospecting to closing, playing a pivotal role in expanding our SaaS solutions within the manufacturing industry.

In this role, you’ll be at the forefront of our growth strategy, engaging with C-suite executives and senior decision-makers to position Azumuta as a must-have solution. Your ability to build long-term relationships, navigate complex sales cycles, and drive strategic deals will be key to your success.

Founded in 2016, Azumuta is a Manufacturing SaaS scale-up. Through a comprehensive software, tailored to the manufacturing industry, Azumuta delivers solutions to factories around the world. The platform enables digitalization, boosts operational efficiency, facilitates compliance, and helps managing quality and safety.

🚀 What You’ll Be Doing:

Drive Strategic Sales Growth:

  • Own and execute a sales strategy targeting mid-market and enterprise accounts, with a strong focus on manufacturing.

  • Build trusted relationships with C-suite and senior decision-makers.

  • Manage the full enterprise sales cycle, closing complex, multi-stakeholder deals.

  • Strategically develop and expand your territory to maximize growth.

Build & Manage a High-Value Pipeline:

  • Proactively identify, engage, and develop high-value enterprise opportunities.

  • Map accounts and buying groups to understand decision dynamics.

  • Use CRM and data insights to manage pipeline, forecasting, and prioritization.

Deliver Customer Value

  • Partner with Pre-Sales and cross-functional teams to deliver tailored, value-driven solutions.

  • Act as a trusted advisor, positioning the platform as a strategic, long-term solution.

  • Help clients understand how the software can significantly impact their operations, with a special focus on manufacturing and industrial applications.

Negotiate & Deliver Long-Term Value:

  • Lead negotiations for complex, high-value contracts that maximize long-term partnerships.

Industry Thought Leadership & Brand Representation:

  • Build market presence through key industry networks and events.

  • Stay ahead of market trends and competitors to sharpen your sales approach.

Requirements

🎯 You’d Be a Great Fit If You…

  • Have 5+ years of B2B SaaS sales experience, working with mid-market & enterprise accounts

  • Have experience in or a strong affinity for manufacturing environments

  • Demonstrate a proven track record in closing high-value, complex deals (long sales cycles with multiple decision-makers)

  • Bring strong full-cycle sales expertise: prospecting, discovery, negotiation, and closing

  • Are a consultative seller, engaging C-level and senior stakeholders

  • Are fluent in Dutch and English

  • Are results-driven, thriving in fast-paced environments

  • Are passionate about digital innovation and its impact on industrial transformation

🤩 Extra Bonus Points If You…

  • Have hands-on experience in the manufacturing or industrial sectors, understanding the challenges and opportunities within these industries.

  • Are fluent in additional languages (French, German, etc.) to engage with a broader range of clients.

💜 What’s In It for You?

On top of a competitive salary, we offer a range of benefits to support your well-being and growth:

🍽 Meal vouchers – Enjoy daily meal perks.

🏥 Healthcare benefits – Including Alan daily care & hospitalization insurance.

⏳ Flexibility & balance – Flexible hours with in-office collaboration (please note, this is not a remote position!).

💻 Top-notch equipment – The best tools and tech to help you succeed.

🚀 A key role in a fast-growing scale-up – Join an ambitious international team with endless learning and growth opportunities.

🎯 Ownership & impact – Take on real responsibility and make a difference from day one.

🎉 Fun & team spirit – Regular team-building activities and a vibrant company culture.

🍫 Unlimited snacks & drinks – Because great work deserves great fuel!

👕 Awesome Azumuta merch – Represent the team in style!
